properties.Content: On Asylia of the sanctuary, when Publius Servilius Isauricus was proconsul of Asia. It concerns a legal dispute between the city and a Roman named Marcus Fannius
properties.Comments on content: The dispute was likely won by the city, according to Habicht, because the decree was placed in the sanctuary.
properties.Location found: Found in 1927 in the Aiwas-Ali garden near the Asklepieion
properties.Location - intended: Very likely the Asklepieion, due to it concerning the asylia of the sanctuary
properties.Pergamenes (pilgrims): Apollophanes Orestos; Asklepiades Matronos; Perseus of Perseus of Dionos; Herodes of Herodes; Kleitos Timonos; Kriton of Menodoros; Menemachos, son of Zenokleos; Moirophanes, son of Metrodoros; Neon, son of Meleagros
properties.Romans (other): M. Fannius Numerii; P. Servilius Isauricus
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: Marcus Fannius; Publius Servilius Isauricus (proconsul of Asia); Apollophanes Orestos; Asklepiades matronos; Perseus of Dionos; Herodes of Herodes; Kleitos Timonos; Kriton of Menodoros; Menemachos, son of Zenokleos; Moirophanes, son of Metrodoros; Neon, son of Meleagros

properties.Content: State consultation of oracle in Didyma for the burial of the Heroes Marcellus and Rufinus.
properties.Comments on content: Not very careful writing according to Habicht. Reply missing
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasiswall of the Northern hall
properties.Location - intended: Likely in the northern hall

properties.Content: Honours for Athenaios after being agonothetes of the second Soteria and Herakleia
properties.Location found: Found in the Roman temple of Asklepios (Temple of Rufinus, sponsor of the round temple)

properties.Content: Honours for a Pergamene citizen by the Ionian League
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Honouring Hadrian; originally included a statue of him
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.Comments on location: A head of Hadrian was found in the Hallenstra?e, which might have belonged to the base

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Honours Hadrian as a god - θεὸν Ἁδριανόν - by Fl. Melitine
properties.Comments on content: Dedicated by Flavia Melitine, see IvP III 38
properties.Location found: Found in the library (square building to the east of the northern hall)

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Honour of the adopted L. Ceionius Commodus as L. Aelius Caesar (but died before Hadrian)
properties.Comments on content: Placed by the high priest of Asia Claudius or Flavius Temon. The last two lines in smaller font
properties.Location found: Found in the centre of the northern hall
properties.Location - intended: unclear
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: L. Ceionius Commodus (consul); Trajan; Nerva; Hadrian; [F?]lavius Temnon

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Honour for Antonius Pius, placed by Antonius Claudius Charax
properties.Comments on content: Charax is also mentioned in no. 141 as donor of the Propylon. He was philosopher and historian
properties.Location found: East of the Roman Baths

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Statue base for Antonius Pius
properties.Comments on content: Unkown dedicant. The Boule is mentioned
properties.Form: Upper corner of a statue base
properties.Location found: Found at the fountain in front of the theatre

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Statue base for Marcus Aurelius as Soter and Ktistes
properties.Location found: Found in front of northern hall, in front of the 13th pillar from the east
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: Trajan; Nerva; Hadrian; Antoninus Pius; L. Cuspius Pactrumeius Rufinus; Quintilius

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Statue base for Lucius Verus (co-emperor Aurelius) as Soter and Ktistes
properties.Location found: Statue base found in unkown location; Left upper corner found at the "Festplatz" (open space between Propylon and Hellenistic Temple)
properties.Comments on location: As it was dedicated to the co-emperor and one part was found in the large open space, it seems likely that it stood close to M. Aurelius' statue
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: Trajan; Nerva; Hadrian; Antoninus Pius; Quintilius

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Statue base in Latin of emperor Caracalla, depicted as priest
properties.Comments on content: This one is in Latin instead of Greek. The name of the dedicator has been extremely well erased so that no remnants of a name can be found
properties.Location found: Found east from the Roman baths
properties.Comments on location: A head for this base has been found near the Roman baths. Caracalla was presented as Priest

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Base for a head of Caracalla
properties.Location found: Found in front of the northern hall at the side of the theatre
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Base in Latin for Caracalla; dedicated by, according to Habicht L. Didius Marinus and Aristaenetus
properties.Comments on content: The inscription is in Latin and is similar to no. 15, the statue base for Julia Domna
properties.Form: Fragment of the top of a statue base
properties.Location found: Found at the south-eastern corner of the Asklepios temple
properties.Comments on location: The temple is the round Asklepios-Soter temple and not the Hellenistic temple, based on the names given by Habicht on his plan of the complex
properties.Translations and other literature: Habicht's version fills in more gaps in the text than the previous editions
properties.Romans (other): Aristaenetus, now named Aur. Tacitus; L. Didius Marinus

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Base in Latin for Julia Domna, mother of Caracalla. Dedicated by Marinus and the freeman Aristaenetus, now named Aur. Takitus
properties.Comments on content: The inscription is in Latin and is the similar to no. 14, the statue base for Caracalla
properties.Form: Fragment of the top of a statue base
properties.Location found: Found at the sout-eastern corner of the Asklepios temple
properties.Comments on location: The temple is the round Asklepios-Soter temple and not the Hellenistic temple, based on the names given by Habicht on his plan of the complex
properties.Dedicant: Marinus;  Aristaenetus, now named Aur. Tacitus
properties.Romans (other): Aristaenetus, now named Aur. Tacitus; L. Didius Marinus

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Dedication in Latin to Julia Domna, mother of Caracalla. Dedicated by Romanius Montanus who was procurator familiarum gladiatorum
properties.Comments on content: Inscription is in Latin; a Christian name is carved into it in Greek
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.Location - intended: Originally based in the Asklepieion based on the relationship with Caracalla and Julia Domna (Nos 12-15
properties.Comments on location: Reused in a Christian home

properties.Habicht_cat: B.b. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Kaiserhauses
properties.Content: Too fragmented to tell
properties.Comments on content: Habicht categorises it under honours for Emperors and imperial family members
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Statue base for Tertia Lollia, wife of proconsul (??) of Asia for Euergetism, by the demos of Pergamon
properties.Comments on content: Habicht thinks it is likely that her husband also had a statue close to this one, not on a wall as previously thought but on a second statue base
properties.Location found: Found in the hall SW of the Theatre Skene (westhall)
properties.Honoree: Tertia Lollia, wife of proconsul (??) of Asia

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Statue base for honouring proconsul of Asia Lucius Calpurnius Piso and his wife Statilia
properties.Comments on content: Likely stood under a statuegroup consisting of 2 statues
properties.Location found: Stands in front of the "Geisonvorderfläche"
properties.Honoree: proconsul of Asia Lucius Calpurnius Piso and his wife Statilia
properties.Romans (other): L. Calpurnius Piso and his wife Statilia Tauri

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Statue base for A. Julius Quadratus for his High Priesthood of Pergamon
properties.Comments on content: Likely of the local cult for the Emperor. Quadratus was also consul in 94 and 105 AD
properties.Form: Lowest part of a statue base
properties.Location found: Found between the Northern Hall and Roman Baths
properties.Location - intended: unclear

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: honour for C. Julius Quadratus Bassus by the city Seleukia at Zeugma
properties.Comments on content: Frontside includes multiple positions occupied by Bassus, a cursus honorum ; backside includes his death and funeral
properties.Location found: Found in front of the steps of the north hall in the area of the theater
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a focal point for honorific statues
properties.Translations and other literature: Habicht is detailed when discussing this inscription
properties.Relation: Armenia; Asia (province); Dacia; Galatia; Isauria; Judea; Cappadocia; Kommagene; Kreta; Paphlagonia; Phoenicia; Phrygia; Pontos; Seleukeia at Zeugma; Syria

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: honour for C. Julius Quadratus Bassus by the city Seleukia at Zeugma
properties.Comments on content: Frontside includes multiple positions occupied by Bassus, a cursus honorum ; backside includes his death and funeral
properties.Location found: Found in front of the steps of the north hall in the area of the theater
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues
properties.Translations and other literature: Habicht is detailed when discussing this inscription

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Honours for Procunsul of Asia L. Hedius Rufus Lollianus Avitus by the city of Pergamon
properties.Comments on content: Likely 2 or more statues
properties.Location found: Found in front of the stairs of the temple of Asklepios
properties.Honoree: Proconsul of Asia L. Hedius Rufus Lollianus Avitus
properties.Dedicant: Boule and demos; T. Flavius Claudianus; Ti. Julius Aelius Tatianus; C. Julius Bassus Claudianus; C. Silius Otacilianus
properties.Pergamenes (Roman citizens): T. Flavius Claudianus; Ti. Julius Aelius Tatianus; C. Julius Bassus Claudianus; C. Silius Otacilianus
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: T. Flavius Claudianus; Ti. Julius Aelius Tatianus; C. Julius Bassus Claudianus; C. Silius Otacilianus

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Honours for Sextus Julius Maior Antoninus Pythodoros for eusebia
properties.Comments on content: This is, according to Habicht, the same Antoninus that renovated the Epidaurian Asklepieion mentioned by Pausanias (2.27)
properties.Location found: Found at the open space (Festplatz) in front of the Northern Hall across the Theater
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues
properties.Pergamenes (Roman citizens): M. Julius Quartus; Ti. Cl. Chresimus

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Honours for Quaestor of the province of Asia Marcus Junius Hermogenes for euergetism
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.Honoree: Quaestor of the province of Asia Marcus Junius Hermogenes

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Honours for senator Flavius Pollio Flavianus by a friend for euergetism
properties.Location found: Found in front of the eastern wing of the theatre in the Festplatz
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues

properties.Habicht_cat: B.c. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des senatorischen Standes
properties.Content: Honour Flavius Ranios Pollio; likely son of no.25. The statue is of his father.
properties.Comments on content: He was priest and agonothetes for Asklepios Soter. Letters distorted due to water damage.
properties.Location found: Found at the open space (Festplatz) in front of the Northern Hall across the Theater
properties.Romans (other): Flavius Ranius Pollio Flavianus; Flavius Pollos Flavianus

properties.Habicht_cat: B.d. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Ritterstandes
properties.Content: Honours Titus Julius Perseus, placed by the Praetor Julius Major on his own costs
properties.Comments on content: The boule and demos were involved in the decissionmaking, but did not pay. Perseus was also honoured in an Asklepieion in Hamman Ellif (Tunesia) when stationed there
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis of the northern hall
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues
properties.Romans (other): T. Julius Perseus; S. Julius Maior Antoninus Pythodorus

properties.Habicht_cat: B.d. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Ritterstandes
properties.Content: Honours an imperial secretary Claudius Vibianus Tertullus
properties.Comments on content: Boule and Demos involved in decission - and thus also involved in location?
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis of the northern hall
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues

properties.Habicht_cat: B.d. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Ritterstandes
properties.Content: Honours imperial procurator L. Aurelius Lathicedes, placed by his brother Ti. Claudius Nicomedes, neokoros of Thea Rome and Theos Augoustos
properties.Comments on content: Mentions also Thea Rome and Theos Augoustos
properties.Location found: Found at the peristasis of the northern hall
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues
properties.cult role: neokoros of Thea Rome and Theos Augoustos

properties.Habicht_cat: B.d. Ehreninschriften. Für Angehörige des Ritterstandes
properties.Content: Honours Roman Knight Tiberius Claudius Pius
properties.Comments on content: Mentions all his positions
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.Location - intended: Based on other honours for similar people, possibly the northern hall

properties.Content: Honours  the Sophist Tiberius Claudius Nikomedes
properties.Comments on content: Boule and Demos involved in decission - and thus also involved in location?
properties.Location found: Found between the Northern Hall and Roman Baths
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues

properties.Content: Honours the philosopher Tiberius Claudius Paulinus of Antiocheia in Pisidia
properties.Comments on content: Boule and Demos involved in decission - and thus also involved in location?
properties.Form: Block and Statue base for originally a bronze statue
properties.Location found: Found in front of the Northern hall near the theatre
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues
properties.Romans (other): Ti. Claudius Paulinus from Pisidian Antioch

properties.Content: Honours Demosthenes of Athens - his role model -  by the sophist Polemon
properties.Comments on content: Placed after a dream. Possibly thus after incubation, altough no illness is mentioned
properties.Location found: Found in front of the north hall in the theater area not far from the Roman baths
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues
properties.Other (pilgrims): Demosthenes of Demosthenes Paianieus of Athens

properties.Content: Honours the Sophist L. Flavius Hermocrates
properties.Comments on content: Boule and Demos involved in decission - and thus also involved in location?
properties.Location found: Found between the Northern Hall and Roman Baths
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues

properties.Content: Honours the Sophist Marcus Acilius Diodotus of Caesarea-Mazaka (Cappadocia) by Aurelius Glycon Julianus
properties.Comments on content: Boule and Demos involved in decission - and thus also involved in location?
properties.Location found: Found within the rear wall of the Northern hall with only writing surface visible

properties.Content: Honours  Demetrios Milates, a priest for life of the Imperial cult
properties.Comments on content: He also established a festival for the emperor in the Asklepieion (????????? ?[?] [??]? ??? ???[??]?? ??????[???] [??]????? ???????? ???[?]- [??]?)
properties.Form: Two fragments of a statue base
properties.Location found: 1 fragment Found in the rubble near the Asklepios temple; the other at the temple
properties.Comments on location: The first fragment was reused as a building block
properties.cult role: Priest for life of Imperial cult

properties.Content: Honours Tiberius Claudius Menogenes with Ktistes for being gymnasiarch and for euergetism
properties.Comments on content: Boule and Demos involved in decission - and thus also involved in location?
properties.Location found: Found in front of the middle of the Northern Hall
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues

properties.Content: Honours Flavia Melitine, wife and mother of two prytanen
properties.Comments on content: Reason for honours: financing of the library in Asklepieion. Boule and Demos involved in decission.
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis of the northern hall
properties.Comments on location: It seems strange that she is not honoured in the library, altough the exact location of her statue in the northernhall is unspecified and could thus be near the entrance
properties.Profession or magistracy: Wife and mother of two prytanen

properties.Content: Honours Sex. Claudius Silianus Aesimus for being agonothetes of Asklepios
properties.Comments on content: Boule and Demos involved in decission - and thus also involved in location?
properties.Location found: Found in front of the northern hall
properties.Comments on location: This place seems to have been a vocal point for honorific statues

properties.Content: Honours S. Claudius Aesimus, son of L. Silianus
properties.Comments on content: Same family and similar content as no. 39. Boule and demos involved
properties.Location found: Found near Elaia (port of Pergamon)
properties.Location - intended: The Asklepieion
properties.Comments on location: It is suspected that it was moved from the Asklepieion due to similarity in content and family to nr. 39
properties.Honoree: S. Claudius Aesimus, son of L. Silianus

properties.Content: Restored to honour the sophist Ti. Claudius Nicomedes of Pergamon
properties.Comments on content: very fragmented tekst
properties.Location found: Found in upper tier of the theater

properties.Content: Honours Marcus Ulpius Pius for euergetism
properties.Comments on content: Boule involved in decission
properties.Material: White Marble originally with bronze statue
properties.Location found: Found at the stairs of the Asklepios-soter temple

properties.Content: Honours Julia Pulchra
properties.Comments on content: Cf Julia Pulchra in IvP 292; Father possibly C. Julius Pulcher, Archiereus; Brother neokoros
properties.Location found: "Sondage nach dem Strassentor" - close to Via Tecta gate
properties.Comments on location: Habicht only knows this one from a photo

properties.Habicht_cat: B.g. Ehreninschriften. Für einen kaiserlichen Freigelassenen
properties.Content: Honours freedman and Procurator Saturnius by his friend and Asiarch Aurelius Gaius
properties.Location found: 10m north of the Propylon
properties.Location - intended: unclear
properties.Romans (other): S. Quintilius Condianus?; S. Quintilius Maximus

properties.Habicht_cat: B.g. Ehreninschriften. Für einen kaiserlichen Freigelassenen
properties.Content: Honours freedman and Procurator Saturnius by his friend and Asiarch Aurelius Gaius
properties.Location found: 10m north of the Propylon
properties.Location - intended: unclear

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Honours Flavius Aristomachus, son of Flavius Asklepiades
properties.Comments on content: Priesthood became hereditary to the family of Asklepiades son of Archias in the Hellenistic Period (IvP II 251). Seems that the family became Roman
properties.Location found: Northwest of the stairs of the Asklepios-Soter temple
properties.Honoree: Flavius Aristomachus, son of Flavius Asklepiades

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Fragmented, but Habicht names it in his list with honours for priests and cult personnel
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Honours Titus Flavius Asklepiades
properties.Comments on content: Habicht argues that the family of the hereditary priest gained citizenship by a Flavian emperor
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis wall of the Northern hall
properties.Location - intended: Because it concerns a statue, in the wall was not the intended location
properties.Comments on location: Possibly originally placed in the hall in front of the wall

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Honours Titus Flavius Archias, priest of Asklepios Soter placed by his mother
properties.Comments on content: Liekly Post flavian period(after 96 AD)
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis of the northern hall
properties.Honoree: Titus Flavius Archias, priest of Asklepios Soter

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Honours Flavius Asklepiades, priest of Asklepios Soter
properties.Comments on content: Liekly Post flavian period(after 96 AD)
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis of the northern hall

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Very fragmented; restored to Archias Asklepiades priest of Asklepios Soter
properties.Comments on content: possibly pre-flavian (pre 69 AD) because the priestdid not have Roman name
properties.Location found: Location fragment 1 unspecified; fragment 2 found in eastern part of southern hall
properties.Comments on location: Fragments do not fit with each other, but possibly belong together according to Habicht
properties.Honoree: Archias Asklepiades? priest of Asklepios Soter

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Very fragmented; restored to Asklepiades priest of Asklepios Soter
properties.Comments on content: possibly pre-flavian (pre 69 AD) because the priestdid not have Roman name
properties.Location found: Found in the library (square building to the east of the northern hall)
properties.Location - intended: On the wall

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Very fragmented; for one Flavius Asklepiades of the priestly family
properties.Location found: 1 found northwestern corner of the sanctuary (close to theatre); 2nd found northeastern corner of the Festplatz
properties.Comments on location: Fragments do not fit with each other, but possibly belong together according to Habicht
properties.Honoree: Flavius Asklepiades of the priestly family

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Very fragmented; for one Flavius Asklepiades of the priestly family
properties.Location found: 1 found northwestern corner of the sanctuary (close to theatre); 2nd found northeastern corner of the Festplatz
properties.Comments on location: Fragments do not fit with each other, but possibly belong together according to Habicht
properties.Honoree: Flavius Asklepiades of the priestly family

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Honours for Asklepiades as agonothetes
properties.Comments on content: Festival not specified in inscription; seems likely to have been Asklepieia. Dated to pre-citizenship of the priestly family. Informs us about the duties of the priestly families. Likely by the demos, but this word is restored
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis of the northern hall

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Honours for the agonothetes C. Julius Faustus Luppianus by the boule
properties.Comments on content: Festival not specified in inscription; likely Asklepieia
properties.Location found: Located eastern part of the Festplatz
properties.Comments on location: Habicht quotes Deubner when mentioning that it likely stood against a wall

properties.Habicht_cat: B.h. Ehreninschriften. Für Asklepiospriester und Angehörige des Kultpersonnels
properties.Content: Honours for Cassianus. For his character
properties.Comments on content: Habicht names him as a neokoros (which is a restored word); keeper of keys,sellers of votives, interpreters of dreams but lower than the priest
properties.Location found: Found in the space in front of theatre
properties.Dedicant: P. Cl. Nicias Aelianus; Cl. Carpus; Cl. Marcianus
properties.Pergamenes (Roman citizens): Cassianus; P. Cl. Nicias Aelianus; Cl. Carpus; Cl. Marcianus; M. Cossutius Rufus Maior
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: P. Cl. Nicias Aelianus; Cl. Carpus; Cl. Marcianus; M. Cossutius Rufus Maior

properties.Content: End of a honorific inscription for unknown person
properties.Comments on content: A name Glykon is found, but several prominent people from Pergamon had this name
properties.Location found: Found between the northern hall and sacred spring

properties.Content: Honorific inscription for a "Soter" of the city
properties.Comments on content: Name is unkown
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz between old and new spring

properties.Content: Remnant of honorific inscription for the agoranomos Pompeius
properties.Comments on content: Unkown whether he is Pergamene with citizenship or a Roman senator with the function of aedilis (which is a translation of agoranomos)
properties.Form: Fragment of a round statue base
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.date: ca. 100 BC - at the latest 14 AD
properties.Content: Remnant of honorific inscription by the demos for a Roman named Publius Pon[…] for euergetism
properties.Comments on content: It is dated to the late hellenistic period because after the reign of Tiberius the boule is frequently mentioned in combination with the demos; Hellenistic period the demos alone
properties.Location found: Found near Hellenistic well (schöpfbrunnen)

properties.Content: End of a honorific inscription for Strategoi
properties.Comments on content: Habicht interprets the fragmented names as A. Julius Dionysius and Julius Asklepiacus
properties.Location found: Found at the Cryptoporticus
properties.Comments on location: It is unclear to me whether it was at the entrance, above or in the cryptoporticus

properties.Content: Really fragmented with two interpretations: honorific or votive
properties.Comments on content: If ???? is restored as part of neokoros: honorific; if ???? is part of Koronidi it is votive
properties.Location found: "Gefunden am Trachytquaderbassin"
properties.Comments on location: I do not know this basin; it does not appear on the map

properties.Content: Really fragmented;
properties.Comments on content: Habicht restores it as a honorific inscription
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz

properties.Content: Fragment of honorific inscriptions
properties.Location found: Removed from northwestern corner of northern stylobates

properties.Content: Dedication by Aemilius Sabinus and Aemilius Herennianus to Zeus Soter Asklepios
properties.Comments on content: After protection from Barbarians at sea. Habicht specifies the sea to the Atlantic
properties.Location found: Found at the steps of the middle entrance of the southern basement (Südhallenkeller)

properties.Content: Inscriptions on architraves northern hall. Possibly dedicated by Pollion (mentioned in Oratio 29 of Aristides)
properties.Comments on content: Mentions among others: Asklepios and other gods, Hadrian and dedication of the stoa
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.Location - intended: Due to interpretation likely northern hall, above  columns
properties.Comments on location: Inscriptions of the Northern Hall

properties.Content: Dedication of thanksgiving (??) by Menestratos, son of Demetrios to Asklepios Soter and Hygieia
properties.Location found: Found at middle entrance of Southern hall

properties.Content: Dedicated to Asklepios Soter and Hygieia
properties.Comments on content: possibly pre-Hadrian because it does not mention Zeus-Asklepios
properties.Location found: Found in rubble at the Festplatz

properties.Content: Dedicated in Latin to Asklepios and Salus (Hygieia) by Nummius Primus
properties.Comments on content: In Latin, possibly pre-Hadrian because it does not mention Zeus-Asklepios
properties.Location found: Found in rubble in the library

properties.Content: Dedicated by (Faustina the elder) in Latin to Asklepios and Salus (Hygieia)
properties.Comments on content: In Latin, possibly pre-Hadrian because it does not mention Zeus-Asklepios
properties.Location found: Found in the middle of the Cryptoporticus
properties.Location - intended: Not inside the cryptoporticus
properties.Comments on location: It fell inside thus was not originally inside
properties.Profession or magistracy: Imperial freedman or slave? Tabularius proviniciae Asiae

properties.Content: Dedicated to Asklepios Soter and Hygieia, as thanksgiving after being saved
properties.Comments on content: possibly pre-Hadrian because it does not mention Zeus-Asklepios
properties.Location found: Found in the rubble of in the middle of the northern hall

properties.Content: Restored as dedication to Asklepios Soter and Hygieia
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz, norht-eastern courtyard

properties.Content: Dedication by "Asionikes" Attalos of Pergamon (??) to Asklepios Soter and Hygieia after being saved from many dangers
properties.Comments on content: Likely an illness. Attalos of Pergamon is not specified by Habicht. Mentions ???????? which also can be diakonta. Because two bronze snakes have been found, as votives, Habicht interprets it as snakes
properties.Location found: "Bergama"

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios, Hygieia, Koronis, Epione by a woman called Oneso for Gemellus and Epaphrodites
properties.Comments on content: Likely after a dream. First testimony to Epione
properties.Location found: Western part of the Festplatz

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Ti. Likinios Ka[..]
properties.Location found: Found 20m south of roman temple of Asklepios near eastern part of the southhall
properties.Location - intended: According to Habicht, who quotes Wiegand: possibly above a window in the temple

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by L. Albin[i]us Germanus of Alexandria Troas
properties.Location found: Found used as a paving stone immediately north of the altar near the "felsbarre" near theatre
properties.Location - intended: Originally not as paving stone, but unsure where it was intended
properties.Comments on location: Used as a paving stone immediately north of the altar near the "felsbarre" near theatre
properties.Dedicant: L. Albin[i]us Germanus of Alexandria Troas
properties.Romans (other): L. Albin[i]us Germanus of Alexandria Troas
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: L. Albin[i]us Germanus of Alexandria Troas

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Menestheus of Nikaia in Bithynia, after a dream
properties.Location found: Found in the barracks near Asklepieion
properties.Location - intended: Originally in Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedicated to Asklepios Soter by Menestheus of Nikaia after a dream
properties.Comments on content: Dedicated simultaneously as no.75, based on exactly the same tekst
properties.Location found: Found in the barracks near Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedication by a soldier, Lucius Epidotius Domitius of Legio I Italia to Asklepios after a dream
properties.Comments on content: The Legion was stationed in Novae in Moesia inferior from ca. 70 - 300 AD. Unkown whether the mothertongue of the dedicant was Greek; he was likely an italian.
properties.Location found: Found in the barracks near Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedication by C. Flavonius Anicianus Sanctus of Antiocheia (Pisidia) for his son Flavionius Lollianus
properties.Comments on content: Family was Senatorial; placed after a prayer
properties.Location found: Found in a Turkisch graveyard, close to a "Konak", a name for a house normally used for houses used as an official residence
properties.Comments on location: Was later used as garden-decoration in the garden of the Konak
properties.Romans (other): C. Flavionus Anicianus Sanctus from Pisidian Antioch; C. Flavonius Lollianus from Pisidian Antioch

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by a Consul named Flavianus
properties.Comments on content: First three lines restored, but Asklepios Soter is likely due to the inclusion of therapeutes ??????????
properties.Location found: "Gefunden am Trachytquaderbassin"

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Titus Ailios Italos and Claudia Apfion (possibly Appion) for their child Poplius Ailios Meidonos
properties.Comments on content: This was found in the Asklepios temple, which I took as an indication that it is Imperial (Habicht doesn't specifiy dates)Based on the writing of Apfion instead of Appion, the family is likely originally from Asia Minor.
properties.Location found: Found in the temple of Asklepios
properties.Comments on location: Because Habicht does not give a date, it could also have been moved - altough this seems unlikey to me. It is unclear which temple: old or new. Based on Habicht's further mentions of the Asklepios temple, he likely refers to the Roman round temple of Zeus-Asklepios; his plan for example simply names the older temples "Hellenistic temple"
properties.Dedicant: Titus Aelius Italus and Claudia Aphion (possibly Appion) for their child Poplius Aelius Meidon
properties.Pergamenes (Roman citizens): Titus Aelius Italus; Claudia Aphion; Poplius Aelius Meidon
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: Titus Ailios Italos and Claudia Apfion (possibly Appion) for their child Poplius Ailios Meidonos

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Sotas and Dionysia
properties.Comments on content: It has a specific form, copied in Habicht p.116. Habicht argues that it was a disease from which they recovered simultaneously.
properties.Location found: Found in the Asklepieion without further details

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Hermos
properties.Comments on content: Unusual name
properties.Location found: Found at the middle entrance to the southern hall

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Nikephoros
properties.Comments on content: It was likely a (freed) slave; named after Athena Nikephoros
properties.Location found: Found southeast from the large Incubationhall
properties.Location - intended: A hole with bronze wire suggest it was hung
properties.Comments on location: This incubationhall is older than the large complex (it is near the hellenistic buildings). Thus the date can be pre-Roman, but it is not specified

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Threptos
properties.Location found: Found in the Asklepieion without further details
properties.Location - intended: A hole for bronze wire suggests it was hung

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by the priestess Epiktesis, also connected to imperial cult
properties.Comments on content: Link to Emperors: ?????????[???]. That she was female is interesting, as previously the priesthood was tought of as primarily male
properties.Location found: Found in the "Garden of Alexis" near turkish cementaries

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Eueteria
properties.Comments on content: Her eye was healed. She is also named ????????????
properties.Location found: Found north of the Asklepiostemple

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Marcia
properties.Comments on content: Also therapeutheisia. Suggested as imperial due to Roman name
properties.Location found: Found in Northern chamber 1
properties.Comments on location: I do not know which chamber he refers to

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Julia Paulla of Kos
properties.Comments on content: As a thanks to Asklepios (?????????????). Interesting that she used Pergamon instead of the Koan Asklepieion
properties.Location found: Found at thefestzplatz at the west-end of the Southernhall

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter
properties.Comments on content: The writing is "late", but otherwise the dates are unspecified
properties.Location found: Found in the northern hall
properties.Location - intended: It has holes for nails, suggesting it was nailed to a wall or nailed upon something else

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter
properties.Comments on content: Writing distributed unevenly over the tabula
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Fabia Secunda after a dream
properties.Comments on content: Her ears were healed.
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Menestrate daughter of Heliodoros
properties.Comments on content: For her son. The gemination of the Sigma is common from early Hellenistic period onwards
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter
properties.Location found: Found west of the Roman baths on open space "vor dem tempelfundament"
properties.Comments on location: This templefundament seems to be the Hellenistic temple complex

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter
properties.Comments on content: the names of the dedicators are not readable
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter
properties.Location found: Found in the large room of the western hall
properties.Comments on location: "Westhallensaal" as named by Habicht is a bit confusing if taking into account his plan: there is a westraum in the middle of the western hall, but also a südwestsaal southwest corner of the hall. I took the "saal" as an indication that it is the larger room

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Elpis
properties.Location found: Found in front of the northern hall, near sacred fountain/well

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Andromache / Artemidoros
properties.Comments on content: 2 restorations suggested by Habicht
properties.Location found: Found in the barracks near Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Andromache / Artemidoros
properties.Comments on content: 2 restorations suggested by Habicht
properties.Location found: Found in the barracks near Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter and Hygieia as a thanks-offering by Korinthos
properties.Comments on content: Fragmented, so Hygieia is based on a restoration
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter by Herodes
properties.Comments on content: Dated to early second century BC based on letterform
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Soter
properties.Comments on content: Really fragmented; Habicht mentions a possible restauration by Wiegand dating it to the reign of Antonius Pius
properties.Location found: Found at the stairs of the Asklepios-soter temple
properties.Location - intended: Likely was part of a vestibule

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Alexander as arcarius of the imperial ludi (gladiator school)
properties.Comments on content: Likely a (former) imperial slave
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz
properties.Dedicant: Alexander as arcarius of the imperial ludi (gladiator school)

properties.Content: Dedication to an unspecified god by Claudia Pantagathe for children
properties.Comments on content: Likely dedicated to Asklepios, but Wiegand interprets it as dedicated to Artemis
properties.Location found: Found in the northern hall between rubble

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios as epiphanestos theos by G. Varronios Polykleitos
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.References: Robert 1948, Hellenica 6, 51 n.6  - on dedication to Asklepios in Manisa museum (epiphanestatos theos?)

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by a doctor Menoitas of Mylasa (Karia)
properties.Comments on content: He was doctor of actors and possibly gladiators; language reminds Habicht of Attic Drama's. Dedication might have been an altar, but unsure
properties.Location found: Found west of the Hellenistic Schöpfbrunnen (fountain/well)
properties.Translations and other literature: Petsalis-Diomidis 2010 (250ff) parallels the autobiographical dimension of this dedication to Aristides' hieroi logoi

properties.Content: Dedication likely to Asklepios by Publius. Aelius Ingenuus
properties.Comments on content: Asklepios is restored in the tekst. Based on other names with Publius, it is argued that this man received Roman citizenship from Hadrian either directly or indirectly
properties.Location found: Found north of the vestibule of the temple of Asklepios

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by possibly Publius Aelius Nicon
properties.Comments on content: This might be Galen's father, Aelius Nicon (architect and Geometer). But  a name derived from Nikaia or Nikomedia is also possible instead of Nicon
properties.Location found: Found in the Roman Zeus-Asklepios temple

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by M. Ailios Xenodochos
properties.Comments on content: Man from Kardia based on -chos instead of -kos, which is more common  (Xenodokos)
properties.Location found: Found in the middle of the Festplatz

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios Kyrios by Flavius Lucius
properties.Comments on content: He was frumentarius of Legio VI Ferrata
properties.Location found: Found at the western side of the Festplatz
properties.Location - intended: A hole with a bronze wire was likely part of the tabula; thus it hung somewhere

properties.Content: Dedication in Latin to Asklepios by imperial freedman Carpophorus
properties.Comments on content: In Latin instead of Greek; he functioned as a tabularus (accountant of some sorts)
properties.Location found: Found in the eastern end of the northern hall
properties.Profession or magistracy: Imperial freedman or slave? Tabularius proviniciae Asiae

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Agathopos
properties.Comments on content: Likely local Pergamene
properties.Location found: Found in the Festplatz
properties.Location - intended: A hole in the middle of the tabula informs that it was hung

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by […] Julius
properties.Comments on content: The dedicant was male
properties.Location found: Found in the Festplatz, south of the Hellenistic incubationhall

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Herakles for his son Theotimos
properties.Comments on content: The name Theotimos frequently occurs in Pergamon from Eumenes I onwards; therefore possibly hellenistic date
properties.Location found: Found in the westöstlichen mauer der westlichen sondage
properties.Location - intended: A handle with a hole in it might suggest it was hung somewhere
properties.Comments on location: I do not know what Habicht means with this

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by a person named Doros
properties.Comments on content: Doros occurs 3 times in Pergamon: C. Julius Doros offers to Zeus Keraunios (IvP 329); Doros in a list of names during imperial period (IvP 568, 1); and a Doros son of Asklepiades in an Ephebes list (AM 1908, 399 nr. 21 II 10)
properties.Location found: Found in the westöstlichen mauer der westlichen sondage
properties.Location - intended: Small hole with bronze ring suggests it hung somewhere
properties.Comments on location: I do not know what Habicht means with this

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Tapari, likely after eyes were cured
properties.Comments on content: Unclear whether it was a male or female dedicant and name is enigmatic
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios, by AR Agathonike
properties.Comments on content: Unclear what AR stands for.
properties.Location found: Found near the incubationhalls

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Ammion
properties.Location found: Found between the rubble of the Library

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios by Charesis/Charesios
properties.Comments on content: According to Habicht this is a man that should be named Charesios; not a women named Charesis
properties.Location found: Found in front of a door of the western hall
properties.Location - intended: Includes pins to fix it to a wall or something else

properties.Content: Dedication of silver mirrors to Asklepios by Dione recorded on a stele
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication of silver mirrors to Asklepios by Dione recorded on a stele
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Epigram of 2 hexameter
properties.Comments on content: Unclear who  it adresses. Habicht gives 2 options: Asklepios or Emperor
properties.Location found: Found west of the sanctuary near olive groves

properties.Content: Epigram of 2 hexameter
properties.Comments on content: Unclear who  it adresses. Habicht gives 2 options: Asklepios or Emperor
properties.Location found: Found west of the sanctuary near olive groves

properties.Content: Dedication to Asklepios (Gro? ist Asklepios)
properties.Comments on content: The base was not originally intended for this text, but no traces of original inscription
properties.Location found: Found between northern hall and altarfundament, west of the sacred spring
properties.Comments on location: It now stands in the northern hall
properties.Translations and other literature: Translated by Habicht as "Gro? ist Asklepios"

properties.Content: Dedication of altar to Apollo Pythia (Pythia Phoebus) by Marcus Triphonos
properties.Comments on content: Style is poetic
properties.Location found: Found east of the Asklepieion, the Dikeli-Baba hill where an islamic martyr grave is located, with a tower shaped sqaure foundation of trachyte
properties.Comments on location: Dikeli-Baba hill is ? Just east of Dikili

properties.Content: Dedication to Apollo by Proklos, bronze tabula ansata with two ears
properties.Comments on content: It is reminiscent of votives to Asklepios Soter
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to Apollo Soter after a dream by Ammion
properties.Comments on content: Together with previous dedication, it seems that Apollo was venerated as a healing deity in the Asklepieion as well
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz in front of the door to the western hall

properties.Content: Dedication to Artemis after a dream by possibly Julia Balbilla
properties.Comments on content: The inscription writes Phour. Barbilla. Cult of Artemis also in Pergamene Asklepieion, and includes dreams
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.Translations and other literature: Artemis is in Epidauros mentioned as a Soter (IG IV²,1 277) and Aphrodite as ????]???????? (IG IV²,1 280). Thus also in Epidauros some fluidity was present in epithets and functions of other deities in the sanctuary

properties.Content: Dedication to Artemis
properties.Comments on content: Really short inscription. Possibly Roman period, but Habicht does not mention any date
properties.Location found: Found in front of the Propylon stairs

properties.Content: Dedication to Hekate Soteira Artemis phosphoros by an Asionikes Attalos (also therapeutes)
properties.Comments on content: Same dedicant as no. 71
properties.Location found: Found near the Hellenistic fountain/well

properties.Content: Dedication to Leto by high priest Euthydemos
properties.Comments on content: A high priest is unkown for Asklepios; he is also not the ????????? of the imperial cult, which is called ????????? of Asia. Habicht says he was likely hihg priest of all cults of the city. Most other priests like this were known in the imperial period
properties.Location found: Found in front of the northern hall, ca. 20m east of the sacred spring

properties.Content: Fragmented dedication, mentioning Hygieia
properties.Comments on content: Dated based on letters
properties.Location found: Found near the theatre

properties.Content: Dedication to Coronis and Hygieia by a therapeutes
properties.Location found: Found at the stairs of the propylon

properties.Content: Dedication to Hygieia and the muses by Aspasia
properties.Comments on content: It had a statue of her grandson, Herodes of Stratonike
properties.Location found: Found in the temple of Asklepios-soter
properties.Pergamenes (pilgrims): Aspasia of Bokros; Herodes of Demophilos, of Stratonike
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: Aspasia of Bokros; Herodes of Demophilos, of Stratonike; daughter and son

properties.Content: Dedication to the Morai and Nymphs by Marcus Julius Quadratus
properties.Comments on content: Person is not known from other things
properties.Location found: Found in the Asklepieion without further details

properties.Content: Dedication to Telesphoros by Hermes of Pergamon (Imperial slave)
properties.Location found: Found in the barracks near Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedication to Telesphoros Soter by a therapeutes Symphoros
properties.Location found: Unkown

properties.Content: Dedication to a rather unkown goddess Eurostia (possibly personification of good health) by Publius Ailius Theon
properties.Comments on content: Dedicant was a Rhodian who incubated here, as the altar was dedicated after a dream
properties.Location found: Found in the modern city
properties.Location - intended: The Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedication to the saving Panakeia by Flavius … Nikomachus
properties.Location found: Found in a Turkisch graveyard, close to a "Konak", a name for a house normally used for houses used as an official residence
properties.Location - intended: The Asklepieion

properties.Content: Dedication to Aphrodite (here called Kypris) of a gold statue of Aphrodite
properties.Comments on content: Poetic inscription; it is suggested that the dedicant is a Roman equestrian
properties.Location found: Found in the middle of the southern hall
properties.Translations and other literature: Translation on p. 129 is from Herzog

properties.Content: Dedication to Demeter (first attestation of Demeter in Asklepieion)
properties.Comments on content: Dated on the basis of letterform; author draws comparisons to no. 118, a smoke altar to Artemis
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication of the Demos and people (of an Aeolian city, possibly Mytilini) to Elpis, desired by Paian
properties.Comments on content: Paian can be Apollo or Asklepios.According to habicht: this was placed by a city, based on dialect not Pergamon but an Aeolian city + it was after an oracle. This could be Apollo Klaros or Asklepios - the placement here suggests, to me, it was Asklepios of Pergamon
properties.Location found: Found in the middle of the Festplatz
properties.Dedicant: Demos and people (of an Aeolian city, possibly Mytilini)

properties.Content: Dedication of the Demos and people (of an Aeolian city, possibly Mytilini) to Elpis, desired by Paian
properties.Comments on content: Paian can be Apollo or Asklepios.According to habicht: this was placed by a city, based on dialect not Pergamon but an Aeolian city + it was after an oracle. This could be Apollo Klaros or Asklepios - the placement here suggests, to me, it was Asklepios of Pergamon
properties.Location found: Found in the middle of the Festplatz
properties.Dedicant: Demos and people (of an Aeolian city, possibly Mytilini)

properties.Content: Dedication to Taras by a senator C. Julius Nabus
properties.Comments on content: After Taras appeared in a dream. Taras is named a Hero by habicht, possibly linked to "eponymen heros von Tarent"
properties.Location found: Found in front of the middle of the Northern Hall

properties.Content: Dedications to the gods everywhere by Asklepiades
properties.Comments on content: A priest of Asklepios. Pre-Flavian because during his reign the family received Roman citizenship
properties.Location found: Found in front of the middle of the Northern Hall

properties.Content: Dedication to Chthonic gods and hero Tiberius Claudius Paulinus
properties.Comments on content: It is not the philosopher Tiberius Claudius Paulinus honoured in no. 32
properties.Location found: Found in the rubble of the Theatre cavea, eastern side
properties.Location - intended: Originally in a Heroon of Paulinus; likely not far from the Asklepieion
properties.Comments on location: Wiegand thinks this could have been on a hill behind the theatre
properties.Other gods or heroes: Chthonic gods (theoi katachthonoi); hero Tiberius Claudius Paulinus

properties.Content: Dedication to Chthonic gods and hero Tiberius Claudius Paulinus
properties.Comments on content: It is not the philosopher Tiberius Claudius Paulinus honoured in no. 32
properties.Location found: Found in the rubble of the Theatre cavea, eastern side
properties.Location - intended: Originally in a Heroon of Paulinus; likely not far from the Asklepieion
properties.Comments on location: Wiegand thinks this could have been on a hill behind the theatre
properties.Other gods or heroes: Chthonic gods; hero Tiberius Claudius Paulinus

properties.Content: Dedication by a Tatianos
properties.Comments on content: Could be Pergamon strategos Ti. Aelius Julius Tatianus, (IVP 361/2 hadrianic period); a Roman Aelius Tatianus mentioned in IVP 330; or a Tatios or Tatianos mentioned in ephebe lists
properties.Location found: Found in the peristasis in the middle of the wall of the southern hall

properties.Content: Dedication by a Kratinos
properties.Location found: Found in the upper-layer of the rubble in front of the theatre

properties.Content: Dedication by a Mithres
properties.Comments on content: Mithras and Mithras can be theophore names. Based on popularity of Mithras in Roman period, I think it is safe to assume that it is Roman
properties.Location found: Found at the middle entrance of the western hall

properties.Content: Dedication by a Nikoboulos or Nikoboule
properties.Location found: Found at the middle entrance to the southern hall

properties.Content: Dedication by Julius Meidias after a cure
properties.Comments on content: A for Pergamon rare votive stele, mentioning ?????????????, likely bloodletting
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz, between Hellenistic fountain/well and Roman baths

properties.Content: Dedication to a unkown god (top part is unreadable) by a Pardalas
properties.Comments on content: ? implies healing - is sometimes mentioned in combination with therapeutes. Pardalas can be a variety of people: Claudius Pardalas, strategos and Neokoros during Antonius Pius's reign; a friend of of Aristides; a diplomat Ti. Julius Pardala Sard; a C. Julius Pardalas mentioned in a decission of the boule; or a Julius Pardalas who was Idioslogos of Egypt during Hadrian's reign
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Dedication to a unkown god (top part is unreadable) by a Pardalas
properties.Comments on content: ? implies healing - is sometimes mentioned in combination with therapeutes. Pardalas can be a variety of people: Claudius Pardalas, strategos and Neokoros during Antonius Pius's reign; a friend of of Aristides; a diplomat Ti. Julius Pardala Sard; a C. Julius Pardalas mentioned in a decission of the boule; or a Julius Pardalas who was Idioslogos of Egypt during Hadrian's reign
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Mentioning the dedication of the propylon by Claudius Charax
properties.Form: Backwall of the Propylon of Charax, with inscription on a shield
properties.Location found: Found in front of the forecourt of the propylon
properties.Location - intended: It originally was part of the propylon

properties.Content: Dedication by Nikeros , as son of Nike and Eros
properties.Comments on content: The names Nike and Eros could be persons, but due to placement they likely were not
properties.Location found: Found in the space northwest of the stairs of the Asklepios-soter temple

properties.Content: Dedication by Nikeros , as son of Nike and Eros
properties.Comments on content: The names Nike and Eros could be persons, but due to placement they likely were not
properties.Location found: Found in the space northwest of the stairs of the Asklepios-soter temple

properties.Content: Dedication of [---]nigros of Makedon
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Fragmented
properties.Comments on content: A head in the inscription depicts a women wearing her hair in Flavian style
properties.Form: Fragment with a head of a woman with flavian hair
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz

properties.Content: Hymn/Paean in thanks of Asklepios in thanks of: cures, saving from distress, shipwrecks and storm etc
properties.Comments on content: Replica poem of IvP 324. Authorship is attributed to Aristides
properties.Location found: Found in the rubble of the southern hall, near westside of the round building

properties.Content: Burial stele
properties.Location found: Found east of Asklepieion
properties.Location - intended: Intended for a grave - thus outside Asklepieion
properties.Comments on location: Reused in byzantine grave

properties.Content: Burial stele
properties.Location found: Found east of Asklepieion
properties.Location - intended: Intended for a grave - thus outside Asklepieion
properties.Comments on location: Reused in byzantine grave

properties.Content: The form of ears suggest at first would suggest votive, but its use in burial is strange.
properties.Comments on content: Maybe re-used?
properties.Location found: Found in a grave Grab IX Schnitt XLIII

properties.Content: Rest of a letter of the Emperor with an edict
properties.Comments on content: Likely with privileges, such as certain taxes; exemption from liturgy, immunitas etc. Habicht suggests this privilege could be directed towards the Asklepiades family - heridetary priestst - and possibly is also the edict that gave them Roman citizenship. Another suggestion is that it is directed towards a society of Asklepiadai, doctors.
properties.Location found: Found in the southwestern corner of the sanctaury, "Sondage am der SW-Ecke" Spring 1933

properties.Content: Directed towards Zeus and Asklepios as benefactors of all men.After a vac. Follows Sarapis, Apollo
properties.Comments on content: The content suggests to me that it was a religious stele, possibly a dedication.Habicht categorises it under "fragmente"
properties.Location found: Found in the barracks near Asklepieion, April 1933

properties.Content: Fragmented, but likely part of lex sacra IvP 161 dealing with preliminary rituals
properties.Comments on content: If it is part of the lex sacra, a dating to 100-150 AD is necessary. Somewhat restored already in antiquity
properties.Location found: Found in the cryptoporticus, November 1930

properties.Content: Habicht identifies it as a list of eponymous strategoi of Pergamon during the reign of Domitian
properties.Location found: Found in the theatre, in the middle ring of the eastern part, at a "runde zisterne"
properties.Comments on location: This round cistern is not clearly visible on the map of Habicht in the beginning of his book
properties.Pergamenes (Roman citizens): Valerius; Aelianus; Aeschylinus; Andronicus; Dionysius; Etymon
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: Valerius; Aelianus; Aeschylinus; Andronicus; Dionysius; Etymon

properties.Content: Habicht identifies it as a list of names for sacred positions
properties.Comments on content: Interesting: Pontifex is written in Greek - no archiereus is used
properties.Location found: Fragment 1: found in the northern hall; Fragment 2: found in the Festplatz reused in a grave west of the three litte rooms (SW-corner of the asklepieion I think); Fragment 2: foundplace not stated

properties.Content: List of prominent Pergamene persons. Roman names. Includes province-wide positions, like Asiarch
properties.Comments on content: Dated to rule of Hadrian because of "Avitus", identified to Proconsul L. Hedius Rufus Lollianus Avitus. Other prominent Pergamene: Rufus, (if restoration is correct) the sponsor of the temple of Asklepios-soter
properties.Location found: Found in the Cryptoporticus

properties.Content: List of Roman names
properties.Comments on content: Date range is large: Tertullos  could refer to Tertullius, a strategos of Severan dynasty, but it can also refer to a secretary of no.28. Major could refer to a praetorian honoured in no. 27. Korinthos and Chrestos are free slaves. Possibly Menandros as well
properties.Location found: found south of the ""Felsbarre"
properties.Pergamenes (Roman citizens): Q. Flav[onius]; Florius; Fortius; Chrystus; Maior; Maximus; [Ter]tullus
properties.other prosopography (needs cleaning or o: Apollonides; Korinthos; Menandros; Q. Flav[onius]; Florius; Fortius; Chrystus; Maior; Maximus; [Ter]tullus

properties.Content: Refers to the family of Claudius Nikomedes
properties.Comments on content: Date range is large, as it is unclear whether the Nikomedes here is the same as in no. 31. Same family as mentioned in no. 31. Quintillian is also mentioned, which might refer to the family mentioned in no. 153.
properties.Location found: Not stated

properties.Content: Refers to Flavius, possibly Flavius Asklepiades
properties.Comments on content: Same stone as no. 155. If interpretation correct, it is during or post-flavian dynasty
properties.Location found: Not stated
properties.Comments on location: Found together with no. 155

properties.type: cornice and sima of a gateway
properties.Content: Refers to Pergamon as Neokoros
properties.Form: cornice and sima of the street gate
properties.Location found: Found at the right entrance of the Asklepieion
properties.Location - intended: Originally ca 150m outside the Asklepieion, part of the streetgate that closed the Via Tecta

properties.Content: Inscription refers to Hygieia. PHI has several suggestions for restaurations
properties.Comments on content: Dating based on Deubner; Habicht is cautious and suggests further excavations in order to date it
properties.Location - intended: Part of Doric column drums of the eastern wall of the Hellenistic temple

properties.Content: Inscription refers to Hygieia. PHI has several suggestions for restaurations
properties.Comments on content: Dating based on Deubner; Habicht is cautious and suggests further excavations in order to date it
properties.Location - intended: Part of Doric column drums of the eastern wall of the Hellenistic temple

properties.Content: Inscription refers to Hygieia. PHI has several suggestions for restaurations
properties.Comments on content: Dating based on Deubner; Habicht is cautious and suggests further excavations in order to date it
properties.Location - intended: Part of Doric column drums of the eastern wall of the Hellenistic temple

properties.Content: Refers to Eumenes (unclear which one)
properties.Comments on content: Habicht does not want to speculate on whether it was a dedication or something else
properties.Location found: Found at the Festplatz

properties.Content: Includes a torch in its iconography. Restoration of Flavius or Fabius possible, with Habicht preferring Fabius
properties.Comments on content: Includes a torch in its iconography as well as in the tekst (????????). It is linked by Habicht to a mystery of Demeter and possibly to the altar of Demeter in no. 130
properties.Location found: Found in front of the southern wall of the large rooms on the Festplatz

properties.Content: Habicht does not give much information of the inscription it was accompanied by
properties.Comments on content: the font has not yet been assigned to any known system
properties.Location found: Found in the Asklepieion without further details

properties.Content: Preliminary sacrifices to a range of gods before incubation
properties.Comments on content: The inscription informs us about two incubation halls, one named the small enkoimeterion. It also differentiates between people incubation for the same disease several times and people wanting to consult for "different" matters
properties.Location found: Found in 1965 in the "Hallenstrasse" (sacred way) leading up to the Propylon. Supplemented by other fragments: Frg.1 unkown location; Frg.2: underground passage; Frg. 3 among rubble
properties.Location - intended: Possibly before the sanctuary (where it was found) because it concerns preliminary rituals. A second copy could have been available within the sanctuary
properties.Comments on location: The other fragments have been interpreted as a second copy of the same inscription found in the Hallenstra?e
properties.Translations and other literature: Translation in Lupu, pp. 62-63: Lupu, Eran. Greek Sacred Law : A Collection of New Documents (Ngsl) (version 2nd ed. with a postscript.). 2Nd ed. with a postscript ed. Religions in the Graeco-Roman World, V. 152. Leiden: Brill, 2009; Wörrle Michael. Die Lex Sacra Von Der Hallenstrasse (Inv. 1965, 20). Berlin, 1969.
properties.Other gods or heroes: Zeus Apotropaios; Zeus Meilichios; Artemis Prothyraia; Ge; Tyche; Mnemosyne; Themis;

properties.Content: Preliminary sacrifices to a range of gods before incubation
properties.Comments on content: The inscription informs us about two incubation halls, one named the small enkoimeterion. It also differentiates between people incubation for the same disease several times and people wanting to consult for "different" matters
properties.Location found: Found in 1965 in the "Hallenstrasse" (sacred way) leading up to the Propylon. Supplemented by other fragments: Frg.1 unkown location; Frg.2: underground passage; Frg. 3 among rubble
properties.Location - intended: Possibly before the sanctuary (where it was found) because it concerns preliminary rituals. A second copy could have been available within the sanctuary
properties.Comments on location: The other fragments have been interpreted as a second copy of the same inscription found in the Hallenstra?e
properties.Translations and other literature: Translation in Lupu, pp. 62-63: Lup, Eran (2009) Greek Sacred Law : A Collection of New Documents (NGSL) (version 2nd ed. with a postscript.). Religions in the Graeco-Roman World, V. 152; Wörrle Michael. Die Lex Sacra Von Der Hallenstrasse (Inv. 1965, 20). Berlin, 1969.

properties.Content: Concerning priesthood: it became hereditary and it lists the privileges
properties.Comments on content: Descendants of Asklepiades son of Archias receive the priesthood. Maybe family of the Archias mentioned by Pausanias when discussing Epidauros (2.26) and the Archias sent by Eumenes as emmisary to Epidauros (IG IV²,1 60)?
properties.Location found: Two fragments: one below the Great Altar and the other in the southwest corner of the sanctuary of Athena. It was thus not found within the Asklepieion itself
properties.Location - intended: Placed in three sanctuaries: one of them in the sanctuary of Asklepios at Pergamon, another one in the sanctuary of Athena on the acropolis, (40) and the third one at Mytilene in the sanctuary of Asklepios
properties.Translations and other literature: Translation and additional bibliography can be found on http://cgrn.ulg.ac.be/file/206/ CGRN 206

properties.Content: Pergamon grants cult honours to Attalos III
properties.Comments on content: Translation: http://www.attalus.org/docs/ogis/s332.html
properties.Location found: Found near Elaia (port of Pergamon)
properties.Location - intended: The Asklepieion
